item.title: WoW: The War Within â€“ All Priest Hero Talents
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Oracle
  • Archon
  • Voidweaver

In WoW , Priests can play either the DPS or Healer in dungeons in their two Support and one DPS spec. In The War Within , Priest Hero Talents help to add some flavor and effectiveness to one of the game's darling classes, but you can only choose one to spec into, and are always locked off from one of the three available trees based on your spec.

This guide goes over the details for all Priest Hero Talents in The War Within , including the default abilities granted by each Hero Talent spec, which Priest specs are required for each Hero Talent tree, and the exact details on what each Hero Talent in each tree does.

Oracle

Available to Holy and Discipline Priests

Default Hero Spec Ability: Premonition

  • One charge, 1 minute cooldown
  • Grants one of three spells, which rotate to the next in the sequence when cast
    • Premonition of Insight: Reduces the cooldown of the next 3 spells by 7 seconds
    • Premonition of Piety: Increases Healing by 15% and spreads 70% of Overhealing between 4 nearby allies
    • Premonition of Solace: The next single-target Healing spell cast grants them a Shield and reduces damage taken by 15% for 15 seconds

Row One

Left

Middle

Right

Preventative Measures

Preemptive Care

Choice One: Waste No Time

  • Holy spec
    • +25% Prayer of Mending healing
    • +25% Damage for Smite, Holy Fire, and Holy Nova

  • Discipline spec
    • +25% Power Word: Shield absorption
    • +40% Damage for Penance, Smite, and Holy Nova

  • Holy spec
    • Renew duration increased by 3 sec

  • Discipline spec
    • Atonement and Renew durations increased by 3 sec

  • Any Premonition causes your next Power Word: Radiance to be Instant, and reduces its Mana by 15%

Choice Two: Miraculous Recovery

  • Power Word: Life cooldown reduced by 3 seconds
  • Power Word: Life can be used on targets below 50% HP

Row Two

Left

Middle

Right

Assured Safety

Choice One: Divine Feathers

Foreseen Circumstances

  • Holy spec
    • Prayer of Mending applies Power Word: Shield

  • Discipline spec
    • Power Word: Shield applies 4x Prayer of Mending stacks

  • +10% Angelic Feathers movement speed increase
  • Allies proc the effect for you, too

  • Holy spec
    • +2 sec duration for Guardian Spirit

  • Discipline spec
    • +10% damage reduction from Pain Suppression

Choice Two: Save the Day

  • Leap of Faith becomes free to cast for 6 seconds after cast
    • Ignores cooldown

Row Three

Left

Middle

Right

Choice One: Prophet's Will

Divine Providence

Choice One: Fatebender

  • When cast on self, +30% Healing for Flash Heal and Power Word: Shield

  • Gain an additional Premonition charge

  • Premonition effects increased by 40%

Choice Two: Desperate Measures

Choice Two: Perfect Vision

  • Desperate Prayer duration increased by 10 sec
  • Angelic Bulwark absorption increased by 15% of Max HP

  • Premonition cooldown reduced by 15 sec (total 45 sec)

Oracle Ultimate Ability: Clairvoyance

  • Premonition of Solance invokes the Clairvoyance buff, which grants all three Premonitions bonuses at the same time

Archon

Available to Shadow and Holy Priests

Default Hero Spec Ability: Power Surge

  • Casting Halo causes you to create additional Halos every 5 seconds for 10 sec (3 additional casts)
  • Halo Radius increased by 10 yards

Row One

Left

Middle

Right

Perfected Form

Resonant Energy

Manifested Power

  • Holy spec
    • +10% Healing while in Apotheosis and for 20 sec after casting Holy Word: Salvation

  • Shadow spec
    • +12% Damage while Dark Ascension is active and +20% during Voidform

  • Holy spec
    • Allies affected by Halo get 2% extra healing from you for 8 sec
    • Stacks up to 5 times

  • Shadow spec
    • Enemies damaged by Halo take 2% extra damage from you for 8 sec
    • Stacks up to 5 times

  • Halo grants Surge of Insanity or Surge of Light, depending on spec

Row Two

Left

Middle

Right

Choice One: Shock Pulse

Choice One: Word of Supremacy

Empowered Surges

  • Halo also reduces enemy movement speed by 5% for 5 sec
  • Stacks up to 5 times

  • +5% Power Word: Fortitude Stamina bonus

  • Holy spec
    • After benefiting from Surge of Light, Flash Heal is 30% more effective

  • Shadow spec
    • +60% Mind Flay: Insanity and Mind Spike: Insanity
    • After benefiting from Surge of Light, Flash Heal is 30% more effective

Choice Two: Incessant Screams

Choice Two: Heightened Alteration

  • Casting Psychic Scream creates a copy of you
  • This copy casts Psychic Scream again after 4 sec

  • +5 sec Spirit of Redemption duration

Row Three

Left

Middle

Right

Choice One: Energy Compression

Concentrated Infusion

Energy Cycle

  • +30% Healing and Damage for Halo

  • Power Infusion also grants you 10% more Haste

  • Holy spec
    • Surge of Light reduces cooldown of Holy Word: Sanctify by 4 sec

  • Shadow spec
    • Surge of Insanity has a 100% to conjure Shadowy Apparitions

Choice Two: Sustained Potency

  • Halo extends the duration of Apotheosis by 1 sec
  • Can be stored (up to 6 sec) if Apotheosis is not active

Archon Ultimate Ability: Divine Halo

  • Halo now centers on you, and returns to you upon reaching its max distance, essentially doubling the Damage and Healing procs of this spell.

Voidweaver

Available to Shadow and Discipline Priests

Default Hero Spec Ability: Entropic Rift

  • Mind Blast (Discipline) or Void Torrent (Shadow) opens up an Entropic Rift which follows targets for 8 seconds
    • Enemies caught in the Entropic Rift's path take a chunk of Shadow Damage every second while within its damage AoE

Row One

Left

Middle

Right

Choice One: No Escape

Void Blast

Inner Quietus

  • Entropic Rift also slows enemies 70%
  • More slowdown toward the center

  • Entropic Rift procs upgrade Mind Blast (Shadow) or Smite (Discipline) into Void Blast
    • Blasts an enemy for a chunk of Shadow damage, generating Insanity for Shadow spec

  • Discipline spec
    • +20% absorption for Power Word: Shield

  • Shadow spec
    • +20% Damage for Vampiric Touch and Shadow Word: Pain

Choice Two: Dark Energy

  • Void Torrent can be cast while moving
  • +20% Movement Speed while Entropic Rift is active

Row Two

Left

Middle

Right

Devour Matter

Choice One: Void Empowerment

Choice One: Depth of Shadows

  • Shadow Word: Death consumes all absorb shields from your target, dealing an enormous amount of damage
    • Grants 1% Mana (Discipline) or 5 Insanity (Shadow) if a Shield was removed

  • Entropic Rift procs summon Mind Devourers

  • Shadow Word: Death has a high chance to summon a Shadowfiend for 5 seconds
  • Procs on targets below 20% HP

Choice Two: Darkening Horizon

Choice Two: Voidwraith

  • Entropic Rift duration increased by 1 sec every time you cast Void Blast
    • Up to max 3 times (3 sec)

  • Summon a Voidwraith that casts Void Flay
    • Void Flay deals extra damage to high-HP targets
    • Generates Insanity or Mana for every time it hits a target

Row Three

Left

Middle

Right

Voidheart

Void Infusion

Choice One: Void Leech

  • Entropic Rift increases Atonement Healing by 20% (Disc) or Shadow Damage by 10% (Shadow)

  • Discipline spec
    • Void Blast healing with Atonement is increased by 100%

  • Shadow spec
    • Void Blast generates 100% extra Insanity

  • Siphon HP from allies every 2 seconds for 3% HP if they have more HP than you

Choice Two: Embrace the Shadow

  • Gain 3% Magic absorption
  • Shadow Magic damage absorption also heals you

Voidweaver Ultimate Ability: Collapsing Void

  • Discipline spec
    • When you cast Penance (Disc) or Devouring Plague (Shadow), empower your Entropic Rift, increasing damage and size by 10%
    • Entropic Rift now collapses and deals an enormous amount of damage to all enemies within 15 yards

  • Shadow spec
    • Void Blast generates 100% extra Insanity

item.title: Skyrim Player Has Collected a Ridiculous Number of Falmer Ears
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Skyrim player collects 860 Falmer ears, impressing the community.
  • Each Falmer ear weighs as much as an entire Nord man.
  • Skyrim players continue finding new and amusing ways to entertain themselves after a decade.

A Skyrim player has shared the ridiculous collection of Falmer Ears they've amassed over the course of the game. The feat has amused the Skyrim community, who have largely commended the player's efforts.

Falmer are a creepy enemy that Skyrim players often encounter when exploring underground. Skyrim 's Dawnguard DLC expanded upon the backstory of the Falmer, expanding on the mutated Snow Elves. Falmer are completely blind and rely on scent and sound to track a player, and their ears can be collected after slaying them.

It seems that this Skyrim player has a particular grudge against Falmer, or at least runs into them frequently. Reddit user thedude1240 shared a screenshot of their copy of the game in which their Dragonborn is carrying a whopping 860 Falmer Ears. Some players were stunned by this feat, with one pointing out that this meant the player had killed an absolute minimum of 430 Falmer in their time in the game. However, thedude1240 noted that they've killed many more than that, but their Dragonborn can only carry so much.

Skyrim Players Contemplate Slayed Falmer

In fact, the sheer amount of weight the player is carrying purely in Falmer Ears is quite ridiculous. The player is carrying 172 units worth of Falmer Ears, which is equivalent to the weight of an entire Nord man. Some suggested that the player should eat some of them, as they provide buffs that can be useful in combat. However, another pointed out that despite the player's apparent experience in defeating Falmer, they don't seem to have much Alchemy under their belt, as their Dragonborn only recognizes one potential effect of consuming a Falmer Ear out of the four possible.

Of course, with Skyrim being over a decade old, some players have achieved feats even more ridiculous - and impressive - than thedude1240's. One player shared a screenshot of their game where they had attempted to sell 1299227647 gold worth of loot, though there's no way to confirm if it's legitimate gains or something they used Skyrim 's console commands to achieve.

Skyrim players have explored every inch of the world, and are always finding ways to keep themselves entertained. Some players take their time, finishing major Skyrim achievements after a decade or more. However a player chooses to enjoy Skyrim , whether they're stuffing their home with cheese wheels or slaying every Falmer in sight, the expansive and open world gives players plenty to do outside of finishing the story and side quests.

item.title: 6 Most Replayable Megami Tensei Games, Ranked
item.description:
The Megami Tensei series is renowned for a few things in particular, like its novel demon fusion mechanics and its incredibly difficult bosses, but the broad array of RPG mechanics found in these games make for a rewarding, if complex, experience for players.

The story is by far what makes or breaks these games, however, with the ideological and theological battles between law and chaos setting the stage for the battles to come, or the balance between work, leisure, and romance setting the tone for the Persona games. Considering both the impact and variation of the narrative, alongside the presence of the combat, here are some of the most replayable games in the Megami Tensei series.

6 Persona 3: Portable

The Choice Of Gender Sets Two Varied Paths In This Title.

.

Remastered for PC, Persona 3: Portable differs from other titles in the series through the opportunity for players to select whether to play as male or female. Far from a simple aesthetic choice, the choice of gender in this game frames how NPCs interact with the protagonist, as well as what characters are romanceable.

With Persona 3 's recent remake changing how Persona games are seen, P3P is set to receive a similar newfound wave of recognition. The long playtime, dual endings, complex combat, and gender-specific details make P3P a game worthy of several playthroughs.

5 Shin Megami Tensei: Vengeance

This Updated Title Has Enough Detail To Satisfy Many Playthroughs

Shin Megami Tensei: Vengeance takes the lackluster story and worldbuilding of the original title and reinvigorates it, turning it from sub-par to stellar with a variety of changes. The in-depth systems such as the monster haunts and magatsuhi rails mean that exploration and experimentation are heavily rewarded.

While SMTV has a variety of endings, only two are available through the canon of vengeance, but six are offered in total if the player can manage the canon of creation, which has the updated mechanical changes from Vengeance but lacks the same engaging story.

4 Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey Redux

A Remaster Brings An Incredible Story To New Devices, With Several New Endings

Strange Journey Redux tells one of the most compelling stories in the SMT universe to date, with the many layers of the schwarzwelt revealing a bizarre reflection of the modern world. The remaster on the 3DS brings with it (alongside the ever-present Atlus remake girl) a story that has broadened to make room for three new endings, offering the player six in total.

Beyond these six endings to aim for on subsequent playthroughs, demons in this game synergize with the protagonist based on their moral alignment running from lawful, to neutral, to chaotic, meaning that through different games, changing up the alignment of the MC leads to vastly different party compositions.

3 Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor 2

A Novel Take On SMT Combat That Retains The Branching Narrative

This isometric, strategy-style RPG marks the sequel within an incredible SMT subseries and one of the most celebrated SMT titles to come out of the DS era of games. The game's compelling characters, and how they are inevitably divided along the lines of law and chaos make for a great game to play through several times over.

Beyond this, the game opens up based on the character's choices towards the mid-late game, as opposed to right before the final dungeon, meaning there is plenty to see in subsequent runs with a different alignment and set of narrative decisions.

2 Persona 4: Golden

This Definitive Title Brings Romance And Moral Dilemmas To The Forefront

The punchy and powerful Persona gameplay alone is enough to leave players enthralled for multiple runs, but Persona 4: Golden brings with it a deep mystery that is all the more satisfying to watch unfold after the initial resolution from the first playthrough.

Couple this with a robust bonding system that shifts how the narrative flows, alongside a slew of endings, and P4G will have gamers playing from start to finish several times over. The presence of mechanics like demon negotiation and baton passing make this an excellent introduction for players looking to get into any other megaten titles.

1 Shin Megami Tensei 3: Nocturne

Get Ready For A Fist-Clenching Difficulty, And Jaw Dropping Replayability

Shin Megami Tensei 3: Nocturne is seen as one of the crown jewels of the Megami Tensei series, and rightfully so. If players are suited for the sort of challenge and pull-no-punches gameplay that Nocturne offers, they'll find a deeply rewarding story, a complex NG+ system that actively rewards subsequent playthroughs (albeit still turning up the difficulty), and a host of side-content that will push the demi-fiend's skills to their limit.

Besides setting the standard for all following SMT games, Nocturne has a host of endings that reward broader gameplay than simply picking moral choices, with character allegiances and side quest completion necessary to get some of the trickier endings.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Guide - Materials, Crafting, Quests, Recipes, and More
item.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley is an adventure/life-sim hybrid. While it is similar to other life-sim games like Animal Crossing , Disney Dreamlight Valley has managed to forge an identity for itself beyond just allowing you to hang out with all of your favorite Disney characters. In the pre-expansion story for Disney Dreamlight Valley , you return to the mysterious place known as Dreamlight Valley after having been gone for many years.

Dreamlight Valley is not as you left it, though. A form of dark magic has spread across the valley during an event called The Forgetting. The valley has become a shadow of what it once was, and it is up to you to restore it. While exploring Dreamlight Valley, you will meet and befriend a massive cast of Disney/Pixar characters. In this game, you can fish, cook, grow crops, and make the village of your dreams. There has been a large amount of content added to Disney Dreamlight Valley since it first came out in 2022, and this directory will continue to be updated as more content comes out over the next year.

Updated September 3, 2024 by Paul Woodward: The lastest update for Disney Dreamlight Valley added Tiana and the third and final act of A Rift in Time. But where one story ends, another begins. There is still much more content on the horizon for Disney Dreamlight Valley , and players are excited for what is coming in the future. Timon and Pumbaa are coming to the game later this year and it wouldn't be a surprise to see another expansion announced before the end of 2024. In the meantime, this guide has been updated to include coverage of all the new content from the latest update.

  • Getting Started


    Disney Dreamlight Valley is surprisingly complex with all the mechanics and systems that it has. It can be rather overwhelming for new players, especially as some things aren't as well explained as others. This section of the directory will help cover basic mechanics like playing multiplayer, setting up cloud saves, and how to restore Energy.

    • Things to Know

      • All Game Editions Explained
      • Companion Roles and How They Work
      • How to Get Moonstones
      • How to Change Clothes and Hair
      • How to Save Game Progress
      • How to Enable Cloud Saves for Cross-Progression
      • What Energy Is and How to Get More of it
      • How to Play Multiplayer
      • How To Equip Dreamlight Styles (Character Skins)
      • How to Fish
      • How to Move Around Faster
      • How to Hover
      • How to Move Villager's Houses to Eternity Isle
      • How to Add and Remove Villagers
      • How to Trade Items in Multiplayer
      • How to Use the Timebending Table
      • How to Change Your Character's Ears
      • How to Change Your Character's Ears
      • How to Change Your Name

    • Tips & Tricks

      • Beginner Tips
      • How to Farm Star Coins
      • How to Report Bugs
      • How to Get Infinite Energy for Free
      • How to Level Up Friendships Fast
      • How to Unlock Every Achievement/Trophy
      • How to Use the Phone Camera Photo Mode
      • How to Earn Mist Fast

    • Star Paths & Duties

      • How to Complete Cookie Taste Test
      • How To Complete The Ho Ho Ho Task
      • Eggs-ceptional Decorating
      • That's Not Where Eggs Come From
      • The Wonder of Pixar Guide
      • How to Complete All Haunted Holiday Start Path Duties
      • How to Complete All Royal Winter Star Path Duties
      • How to Complete All Lovely Monsters Star Path Duties
      • How to Complete the Majesty and Magnolias Star Path Duties
      • How to Complete the Majesty and Magnolias Star Path Duties
      • How to Complete All The Dapper Delights Star Path Duties

    • Royal Tools

      • How to Find All the Royal Tools
      • How to Customize the Royal Tools
      • How to Upgrade the Royal Pickaxe
      • How to Upgrade the Royal Shovel
      • How to Upgrade the Royal Watering Can
      • What Does Miracle Shovel Varnish Do?
      • What Does Miracle Fishing Bait Do?

    • Animal Companions

      • How to Switch Out Your Animal Companion
      • All Critters and Their Favorite Food
      • How to Feed Sea Turtles
      • How to Unlock Cobra Animal Companion
      • What to Feed Capybaras
      • How to Feed Monkeys
      • Capybara Locations & Schedule

    • Scramblecoin

      • How to Play Scramblecoin
      • How to Unlock All Scramblecoin Pieces

  • A Rift in Time Story Quests & Friendship Quests

    A Rift in Time is the first paid expansion for Disney Dreamlight Valley . Rather than continuing the original story about the Forgetting, A Rift in Time takes place on the long-lost Eternity Isle. Jafar's reckless use of magic has endangered Eternity Isle, and it is up to you to clean up the mess and save the isle from certain destruction as you learn to wield the Royal Hourglass. Along the way, you will meet familiar faces like EVE, Gaston, and Rapunzel. Eternity Isle hides many secrets, and this section of the guide will help you at every step of your magical journey.

    • Story Quests

      • The Port of Many Worlds
      • The Secrets of Eternity Isle
      • The Flying Metal Nuisance (How to Unlock EVE)
      • How to Unlock Rapunzel
      • Diamond in the Rough (How to Unlock Gaston)

      • Sunken Ruins

      • The Hero Pose

      • The Monochrome Mystery
      • Does Not Compute

  • Story Quests, Friendship Quests, and Realm Quests

    You will need to complete various quests to build relationships with the characters around the village and proceed through the story. This section of the Disney Dreamlight Valley directory will cover how to unlock certain characters to bring them to the valley, Friendship Quests, Realm Quests, and Story Quests. Content from the expansion, A Rift in Time , will be in its own section below.

item.title: Deadlock: How to Heal
item.description:
In Deadlock , the last thing players want to do is keep standing in the lane with a fraction of their health remaining. It's a fast-paced game, and your opponents will look to take every bit of advantage they can get. If you're running around with half your health missing, they'll look to quickly move in and take you down, earning a big chunk of Souls in the process.

Before you know it, your opponents will get a major Souls lead over you, and you'll have a hard time competing for last hits, let alone creating kill pressure. To win your lane and come out on top, you'll need to heal your hero every chance you get. Unfortunately, the game doesn't go into too much detail about how to heal in Deadlock .

How To Heal In Deadlock

Leaving combat kicks in a small amount of natural health regeneration in Deadlock . The health regen amount varies from one hero to another, and Mo & Krill and Bebop currently have the highest natural health regen in the game. While natural health regen can come in handy in a tough spot, it isnâ€™t enough to sustain you throughout the laning phase.

Here are all the ways you can heal your hero in Deadlock .

Going Back To The Base

The primary way of healing in Deadlock is to ride the Transit line all the way back to the base. By going back to the base, you'll quickly regain any health you lost in the lane. The biggest downside to this, of course, is that you'll be missing out on Souls from killing enemy Troopers.

Your opponent might also take it as an opportunity to push down the lane and damage your Guardian. You'll also have to leave your lane partner solo against two enemy heroes. Chances are, your opponents will gang up on your ally and kill them before you get back.

If you must go back to base, make sure you push out your lane and get a kill on an enemy hero if possible. That way, by the time you get back to the lane, you won't have to worry about your opponent pressuring your Tower Guardian too much.

Activating Zip Line Boost when you're returning to the base will help you get back to the lane faster, as the speed boost will still be in effect when you come back.

Heal From The Banner Trooper

Troopers are uncontrollable units that walk down each lane, attacking your enemy Troopers and heroes, pushing the lane forward. Each lane spawns a set of four Troopers every 25 seconds . Each set has two Ranged Troopers, one Melee Trooper, and a Banner Trooper.

If you'd rather not ride the transit line back home, stay near your Banner Trooper when you're low on health. The Banner Trooper releases a short burst of healing every six seconds that heals all nearby allied units. For heroes, the heal is 40 HP , which is pretty low on the grand scale, but it's still enough to give you a small health boost during the laning phase.

When one of the Tower Guardians falls, the laning phase officially ends, and the healing amount from Banner Troopers increases to 80 for heroes.

Buying Healing Items

One of the biggest things that sets Deadlock apart from other hero shooters like Overwatch is the ability to buy items for your heroes. By accessing the Curiosity Shop from your base or the lane, you'll be able to buy items using Souls that boost your hero's damage, attack speed, and health. There are also items that can enhance your health regeneration and give you passive or active healing.

For passive health regen, you can get either Extra Regen , which adds a 2.8 Health Regen to your hero, or Healing Booster , which gives you an extra 2 Health Regen . Fortitude is another excellent healing item that heals you for 4% of your hero's maximum HP when you're out of combat for 11 seconds.

A couple of active items in the Vitality section of the Curiosity Shop also come with their own unique healing effects.

Item Name

Item Cost

Active Effect

Healing Rite

500 Souls

Grants 370 total HP regen to a target over a 17-second duration. It also boosts sprint speed by 2m/s.

Restorative Locket

1,250 Souls

Gain one charge whenever an enemy uses an ability within a certain range. Activating the item restores 35 health per charge stored. It can hold up to 15 charges.

Health Nova

1,250 Souls

Grants a total of 260 HP heal to everyone in an 18m radius. Increases total healing by 20% for each additional ally.

Rescue Beam

3,000 Souls

Heals a targeted ally by 30% of their maximum HP for 2.5 seconds. It also heals you for the same amount at the same time.

In the Weapon tab in the Curiosity Shop, you'll find a 500 Souls item called Restorative Shot that heals you for 35 HP when you hit an enemy hero or 10 HP when you hit an enemy Trooper. If the lane seems punishing, it can be a nice item to pick up early on specific heroes. With his high fire rate, Paradox can benefit heavily from this item.

Conversely, Headhunter is a viable healing item for slow-hitting heroes as it will heal for 8% of your maximum HP on every headshot you land on the enemy hero. But it's a tier-3 item that will cost you 3,000 Souls to purchase.

Rescue Beam can be used to save allies caught under crowd-control effects by pulling them towards you during the channeling period.

Buying Lifesteal Items

Other than the healing items in the game, players can also pick up lifesteal items that siphon health from the enemies based on the damage dealt. Similar to healing items, you'll need to buy them from the shop. There are plenty of lifesteal items available in Deadlock , so make sure you browse through the Curiosity Shop when you're setting up a build for your hero.

Lifesteal items are primarily divided into three categories: Spirit Lifesteal, Bullet Lifesteal, and Melee Lifesteal .

  • With Bullet Lifesteal items, you'll regain health with each shot you land with your primary weapon.
  • Spirit Lifesteal heals you when you deal spirit damage with your abilities, items, or even weapons.
  • Melee Lifesteal lets you drain health on melee hits or with abilities that count as melee attacks.

You'll want to first determine which type of damage your hero specializes in before choosing a lifesteal item for your build.

Using Healing Abilities

Deadlock currently features 21 heroes that you can choose from, each with their own unique abilities and item builds. Some of these heroes have built-in healing abilities that can be used to heal themselves or even their allies. For instance, Abrams's Siphon Life ability drains health from enemy heroes and Troopers within a certain range until the effect expires. This ability allows Abrams to play more aggressively in all stages of the game. However, he has no way to heal his allies .

McGinnis , however, can deploy a healing spirit with her Medicinal Specter ability that provides 25 Health Regen per second to all her allies in a specific radius. The healing effect gets further amplified when you push it to the maximum level.

Some heroes also have abilities that grant bullet or spirit lifesteal to their allies. While it's not the same as the direct healing that Abrams or McGinnis have, it's still a great way to get back some of your lost health. So, players should experiment with different heroes to see which healing ability they like the most.

Deadlock is in early development and is subject to regular changes and updates. The final release of the game might feature new abilities and items that boost healing both in the laning phase and later stages of the game.
